channel.title: Combine vs Covenant
channel.description: Just something I thought up because I'm bored.... What if the covenant from halo, maybe in some alternate timeline before they discovered the humans, somehow invaded the half life universe and found the combine overworld? Then what if did what they always do and tried to induct the combine into the covenant? Who would win?

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Solokiller
item.description:
Drop a dark energy reactor in the middle of their forces, set it to overload, but leave the circuit interrupted, an engineer will fix it (that’s what they do) and trigger the overload, killing everything in its range.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
SoaringScout:

Combine.
If Billy Mays did an advertisement for this, it would be. “They have the power to kill 10,000 covenant with a single troop!”

Except that combine soldiers suck and couldnt kill a single anything with 10,000 troops.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: The_Loa
item.description:
The Covenant are masters of traversing their own universe and would win almost any space battle the combine engaged them in, if the Combine even has such technology. The Covenant do not have any way to tunnel between universes tho, and could never launch any sort of offensive against the Combine. All the Combine need to do is open a portal above combine home world or in High Charity and the Covenant are screwed. They wouldn’t
glass their own home planet, just to have the Combine pop up at their new base of operations.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Mr.Shadow
item.description:
Master Chef:

I could point out that the Scarab is also a type of synth (yes, it is a living creature) that is far more impressive than a strider, but I chose not to.

No it’s not. It’s a massive… robot… thing…or something, that’s controlled by millions of worms who somehow together form a intelligent being.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Acristoff
item.description:
OldDirtyBastard:

Sorry to interrupt, but…
Maybe get a life?

Whenever I see someone saying this my palm meets my face and I let out a groan of disappointment in the overall intelligence of humans.

Anyways, if the covenant activated their halos then it would just destroy the combine who are in their dimension, no one knows how it would affect their home dimension.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: borealis117
item.description:
If all of the cov´s army fleet and all appeared in orbit above Combine controlled earth as it was at the begining of HL2 they would start to Glass the planet as soon as they found out most of the population was either flood like or human.

Now.

whether or not the Combine would have time to call home for help, and how long would would that help take to get to earth would not change the multiple beams,(every ship in the covie fleet) Glassing the earth.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
It uses the same textures as blood in that game. It looks EXACTLY like blood. And it comes out of a beating, muscle covered internal organ.

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Master Chef:

The actual game, where they have muscles that bleed when you shoot them. They are basically giant Hunters.

Prove that it’s blood and not oil/some covenant liquid. There are plenty of machines that can leak liquids.

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Master Chef:

Too bad that the Scarab is Covenant technology.

I could point out that the Scarab is also a type of synth (yes, it is a living creature) that is far more impressive than a strider, but I chose not to.

EDIT:

Oh, and Ibanez, I thought that it would be better to utilize 50’s massive backseat and put other memes in the back.

The site of Halo Wars and the Halo wiki don’t mention anything about this though.
In fact the Halo wiki mentions it has many crew members. And I’d say if it was actually alive in some fashion it would’ve been important enough to mention, would it not?
So, what’s your source?

Oh, and it can’t be covenant technology entirely. Since they stole the forerunners technology it is most likely based on a forerunner creation, or at least based on their technology.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Master_Chef
item.description:
Codgin:

the combine would look at the Scarab and then make there own, but bigger and better, and the convenant will be like ohhh no we cant steal any more tech from the forerunners, run!

Too bad that the Scarab is Covenant technology.

Daedalus:

What are you talking about? The synths are glorified creatures with laserbeams coming out of their heads? I don’t understand how you fail to see the technological signifigance of a combination of organic creatures and machines. You just dumb it down to make it seem simple. That’s not an argument. You’re just using it as an excuse to cover up the fact that you have no counter argument.

I could point out that the Scarab is also a type of synth (yes, it is a living creature) that is far more impressive than a strider, but I chose not to.

EDIT:

Oh, and Ibanez, I thought that it would be better to utilize 50’s massive backseat and put other memes in the back.

Read full topic

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Raptor:

How complicated a Strider is doesn’t make it any more powerful. A Scarab could burn it apart with a single shot from its cannon, seeing as Striders can be killed by rockets.

I wasn’t talking about power, but about technological superiority.

item.title: Combine vs Covenant
item.dc:creator: Daedalus
item.description:
Master Chef:

The Citadel is just a big building. The Covenant have a flying city. What do you think is more impressive?

As I said before, the synths are glorified creatures with laser beams coming out of their heads.

The Covenant use portals (and even the humans, to some extent), so I don’t see your logic there.

Awaiting Flames . . .

What are you talking about? The synths are glorified creatures with laserbeams coming out of their heads? I don’t understand how you fail to see the technological signifigance of a combination of organic creatures and machines. You just dumb it down to make it seem simple. That’s not an argument. You’re just using it as an excuse to cover up the fact that you have no counter argument.

Read full topic
